hints_html: What function is the same as its derivative? This question is asking you to draw an example of this type of function.
hints_latex:
What function is the same as its derivative? This question is asking you
to draw an example of this type of function.
hints_raw: What function is the same as its derivative?  This question is asking you to draw an example of this type of function.
question: 2 (d)
sols_html: Any exponential function of the form \(f(x) = a^x\), where \(a\) is a real number, will satisfy the equation above because \(\displaystyle f'(x) = \ln(a)a^x = kf(x)\) for k = ln(a). One example would be our favorite \(f(x) = e^x\). Here k = ln(e) = 1 and a graph is shown below.
sols_raw:
Any exponential function of the form <math>f(x) = a^x</math>, where <math>a</math> is a real number, will satisfy the equation above because <math>\displaystyle f'(x) = \ln(a)a^x = kf(x)</math> for ''k = ln(a)''.  One example would be our favorite <math>f(x) = e^x</math>. Here ''k = ln(e) = 1'' and a graph is shown below. 

:[[File:Math110 april2013 Question2d solution.jpg|350px]]
statement_html:
Sketch a single function satisfying all of the listed criteria.

  1. \(\displaystyle f'(x) = kf(x)\) for some positive constant k.
statement_raw:
''Sketch a single function satisfying all of the listed criteria.''

# <math> \displaystyle f'(x) = kf(x) </math> for some positive constant ''k''.
